results.title: Miracle of the mountains
results.creator_credit: Fortitude Productions, Bob Blasdal, John Schindler and Dick Marks
results.brief_description: Working on no more than a bushman’s intuition Bernard O’Reilly battled for days over miles of dense and seemingly impenetrable rainforest to try and locate a downed Stinson airliner. After a two day battle with the elements he not only located the crashed Stinson but assisted in carrying out two of the survivors. Narrated by John Schindler.

results.title: Miracle of life
results.creator_credit: Cinescience, Pyramid Films, Rokuro Hayashi, David Adams and Jun-Ichiro Takeda
results.brief_description: Details the biological precision of the reproductive process. Shows fertilisation, cell division and growth, and the development of the foetus to the first heartbeat.

results.title: Miracle in Minnesota
results.creator_credit: Empire Photosound Inc and Minnesota Theatre Co Foundation
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the Tyrone Guthrie Theatre in Minneapolis, from construction to opening night. Shows the backstage functions of rehearsal, costume work and set building. Includes excepts from Hamlet, The Mixer, Three Sisters and Death of a Salesman.

results.title: Miracle in Milan = miracolo a Milano
results.creator_credit: De Sica Productions, l'E N I C, Nino Misiano and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: Based on the book ‘Toto il Buono’, acclaimed director Vittorio De Sica has produced a captivating fable, co-written by long-time collaborator Cesare Zavattini, mixing his sometimes harsh reality with fantastic characters and events in an increasingly unreal setting. The main character Toto, himself a rescued foundling, is a philanthropist, determined to help his fellow man in the way he was helped by the woman who adopted him. Mingling De Sica’s trademark neo-realism, in this case the shameful treatment of displaced persons after the War, with whimsical fantasy, this film won Best Film award at the 1951 Cannes Film Festival. Italian language with English subtitles.

results.title: Miracle in Java
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information, United Nations. Film Board and Geoffrey Collings
results.brief_description: Describes the work of Dr Raden Soeharso with his people in Indonesia as he endeavoured to help restore health and ability to work to the handicapped who were maimed and crippled as a result of war. Shows the rehabilitaiton centre built by Dr Soeharso and explains that with aid from the United Nations and other sources he and his staff are bringing new life to thousands.

results.title: Miracle fighters = Qimen dunjia [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Wo Ping Films, Golden Harvest, Raymond Chow and Yuen Woo-Ping
results.brief_description: In this crazed live-action cartoon story of sorcery and supernatural vengeance, legendary director Yuen Woo Ping orchestrates a manic martial arts fantasy extravaganza. A young disciple of some elderly ‘miracle fighters’—martial arts instructors who also possess magical powers—is mistaken for the long missing crown prince. The emperor dispatches a eunuch named Sorcerer Bat to apprehend the boy but first he must get rid of his elderly guardians. The climatic set-piece, an amazing sequence of pure kung fu action, takes place in hell where the eunuch and the young disciple are forced into a contest to determine who is more powerful. Filled with eccentric characters and comic moments as well as a succession of battles, this film spawned four sequels. Cast includes Yuen Yat Choh, Leung Kar Yan, Yuen Cheung Yan. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Miquette et Sa Mere = Miquette and Her Mother
results.brief_description:
Miquette aspires to be an actress. She runs off with a nobleman who promises to make her a star. When Miquette’s mother searches for her wandering daughter, she finds the girl working with a ragtag touring company. The mother takes a job with the troupe to keep the lecherous nobleman away from Miquette. The film works best as a portrait of a provincial theatre in the 19th century.

Credits: Producer, Paul Joly ; director, Henri-Georges Clouzot ; writer, Henri-Georges Clouzot ; photography, Armand Thirard ; music, Albert Lasry ; art direction, Georges Wakhevitch.
Cast: Louis Jouvet, Bourvil, Daniele Delorme, Mireille Perrey, Saturnin Fabre, Pauline Carton, Paul Barge, Leonce Corne, Jeanne Fusier-Gir, Olivier Hussenot, Philippe Nicaud, Pierre Olaf, Maurice Schutz, Louis Seigner.

results.title: Minute movie masterpieces: 30 film classics in 30 minutes
results.creator_credit: Rhino Video, Richard Foos and Cliff Notes
results.brief_description: This compilation video gives a quick synopsis of 30 classic movies ranging from “Birth of a nation” to “A Star is born”. It uses key clips and highlights from each film and a whirlwind narration from speed readers to deliver maximum plot content in the one minute available, before moving on to the next title. Written and edited by David Starns.

results.title: Minus 107
results.creator_credit: Consolidated Film Producers, Artransa Park Studios, Peter Leslie Lamb and Garry Wapshott
results.brief_description: A history of the old gold-mining town of Walhalla in Gippsland, Victoria. Today it is almost a ghost town. Economics forced the closing of the mines after World War I and successive fires have destroyed what was left of the wooden buildings. Features archival footage and stills of the Long Tunnel Mine, richest in Victoria, and the railway to Moe opened in 1910.

results.title: Mint tea = Le The la menthe
results.brief_description: A young man sits on the terrace of a Montparnasse cafe, watching the other patrons as they meet friends, enjoy a drink, flirt, or sit waiting. His own loneliness becomes increasingly apparent against this background of other people, with whom he cannot communicate. French language with some English.
